page.title: 01GAZETTEER GILWERN + GOVILON
page.content: Gilwern and Govilon are situated in the Usk Valley and inspite of the agricultural nature of the area came into being because of the Industrial Revolution.In the surrounding hillsides iron ore,limestone and coal were discovered which resulted in the establishment of the Llanelly and Clydach Ironworks.Tramways were built to all the neighbouring iron making towns.Subsequently the Brecknock and Abergavenny Canal was built,which established a link with the tramways and extended from Brecon to Newport Docks.With the building of the canal the villages expanded and became flourishing communities.Today no industry exists.Since the last war the villages have developed into much sought after residential areas.Residents commute to work to all parts of Wales and England.
